uh I'm NAA sashad and I'm from London
England I practiced as a doctor for a
number of
years and I loved my job uh I was doing
Pediatrics incredibly exciting but there
was always something which was slightly
frustrating about the system and I just
found myself thinking there's got to be
a way to make this
better in that situation you sort of
have two options you either stay within
the system to be able to change the
system from within the alternative is to
step out of the system try to gain those
skills to help you improve the system
from outside and that's the route that I
decided to take in order to try to get
an understanding of how
to I guess analyze some of the problems
which the Health Service faces um in a
rigorous way so I guess that's what
brought me
here doing the joint degree program has
been a fantastic experience not only
have I had the amazing um opportunity to
have three years here which is just
phenomenal but also seeing the contrast
between the two schools and they're so
different the Kennedy School um I've
been really sort of grappling with big
picture policy problems um debating
issues of like social justice and ethics
and then over here it's trying to um
figure out how do you operationalize
some of the decisions which you make but
it's a great way to figure out how
business and government really do work
together and ultimately in the future
business and government are only going
to work more and more closely together
so it's it's an amazing
opportunity what I'm really interested
in is putting together the policy the
practice of medicine and the business
side of healthare and bringing those all
together in a way that um hopefully will
improve the delivery of care for many
people to
